valueString:
MR NEUROGRAPHY OF THE BRACHIAL PLEXUS WITH AND WITHOUT IV CONTRAST


INDICATION:  schwannomatosis and multiple schwannomas of the head, neck, chest and arms, new pain, new cranial nerve loss


TECHNIQUE:  High resolution MRI of the cervical spine and brachial plexus, employing MR neurography techniques on a 3 Tesla system using multiplanar 3-D anatomical and fluid sensitive sequences  IV contrast. The patient received 8 mL of Gadavist 
intravenously.


COMPARISON:  Multiple priors, most recent is dated October 28, 2019.


FINDINGS:


CERVICAL SPINE:
Posterior fossa:  Intact.
Craniocervical junction:  Intact.
Spinal cord:  Intact.


Head and neck structures:  Intact.
Lung apices:  Intact.


Pre-vertebral soft tissues:  Intact.
Paraspinous muscles and soft tissues:  Intact.


Bones:  The vertebral heights are preserved.  The marrow signal is unremarkable.
Alignment:  Anatomical.
Atlanto-occipital articulations:  Intact.
Atlanto-axial articulations:  Intact.


Subaxial C-spine:
C2-C3:  No significant spinal canal or right neural foraminal narrowing. Focal 1 x 1.7 cm left foraminal mass with minimal intraspinal extension. 
C3-C4:  No significant spinal canal or right neural foraminal narrowing. Focal 1.6 x 4.6 x 7.4 cm left foraminal mass with minimal intraspinal extension.  Posterior paraspinal extension. 
C4-C5:  No significant spinal canal narrowing.  Bilateral foraminal masses. Shallow posterior disc bulge. 
C5-C6:  No significant spinal canal narrowing.  Bilateral left greater than right foraminal masses.  Shallow posterior disc bulge with central protrusion. 
C6-C7:  No significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing. Shallow posterior disc bulge with central protrusion. Bilateral left greater than right foraminal masses.  
C7-T1:  No significant spinal canal narrowing.Bilateral left greater than right foraminal masses.  
T1-T2: No significant spinal canal narrowing.Bilateral left greater than right foraminal masses.  


BRACHIAL PLEXUS:
Nerves:
Spinal nerves:  Intact bilaterally.
Brachial plexus:  Numerous bilateral peripheral nerve sheath tumors.  
1.  Left neuroforaminal plexiform lesion at the level of C3-4 is minimally increased, now 7.4 x 2.1 cm  (previously 7.2 x 2.6 cm when remeasured at same location) 
2.  Minimal increase in 1.7 x 2.1 cm lesion left lateral to the larynx without the target appearance and heterogeneous enhancement (1.6 x 1.9). ADC measurement limited by artifact. 
3.  Numerous additional smaller T2 hyperintense targetoid lesions throughout the neck and chest appear unchanged. 
4.  Heterogeneous mass at level of  right apex likely third intercostal space with minimal enhancement (currently 4.4 x 2.2 cm compared with 4.4 x 2.3 cm).  ADC values range from 1.4 to 2.7.
5.  Left posterior upper intercostal measuring 3.3 x 1.6 cm compared with 2.8 x 1.3 cm) with ADC values ranging from 2.2 to 2.6.
6.  Right anterior scalene triangle inferior (T1-T2) at the cervicothoracic junction measuring 2.1 x 3.1 cm with ADC values range from 1.4 to 2.1.


Muscles / Tendons:
Scalenes:  Intact.
Other muscles:  Intact.


Joints:
Sternoclavicular joints:  Normal.
Acromioclavicular joints:  Mild osteoarthrosis bilaterally with synovitis.
Glenohumeral joints:  Normal.


Bones:  Otherwise intact.
Vessels:  Intact.
